title: Executive Order 8905-Exemption of Z. Lewis Dalby From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Z. Lewis Dalby, Chief Counsel, United States Employees' Compensation Commission, who was exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year by Executive Order No. 8538 of September 12, 1940, be further exempted from such compulsory retirement for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby further exempt the said Z. Lewis Dalby from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending September 30, 1942.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8905-Exemption of Z. Lewis Dalby From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/371690
